title: 18 Fonts Similar to Montserrat (Alternatives)
description: Discover 15+ fonts similar to Montserrat that offer versatility & style. Perfect for branding, web design, and more. See top Montserrat alternatives here!
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: Discover 15+ fonts similar to Montserrat that offer versatility & style. Perfect for branding, web design, and more. See top Montserrat alternatives here!
text: When it comes to typography, choosing the right font can greatly impact the overall look and feel of a design. Montserrat, with its clean lines and geometric shapes, has become a popular choice among designers for its modern aesthetic. However, if you’re looking to explore new options and expand your font library, there are several alternatives to Montserrat that offer similar characteristics while adding a unique touch to your projects. Each font on our list has its own distinctive features, such as varying weights, letterforms, and proportions. We will explore their similarities to Montserrat, highlighting their strengths and potential applications. Whether you’re seeking a font with a similar vibe or a fresh take on the geometric sans-serif style, this compilation of fonts will help you discover exciting alternatives to Montserrat that suit your design needs. So, let’s dive into this collection of 15+ fonts similar to Montserrat and unlock a world of typography possibilities to inspire your next project. BEST FONTS SIMILAR TO MONTSERRAT – UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Download all the Fonts Similar to Montserrat you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! 18 Montserrat Alternatives 1. JUST Sans® Clean Modern Minimal Geometric Typeface Just Sans® Clean Modern Minimal Geometric Typeface JUST Sans is a highly versatile typeface with endearing, modernist warmth, geometric legibility, and a distinctive friendly bite. Designed as a professional modern geometric sans serif, JUST Sans is both serious and friendly, neutral but warmly expressive, technical but not overt, and familiar but unique enough to stand on its own. With open-airy characters and a generous width, JUST Sans has an elegant contemporary feel, with sharp angled terminals that give it grip and make it so expressively endearing. For lovers of modern sans serif fonts who are looking for something a tad more warm, open & expressive, JUST Sans is for you. You can download the full JUST Sans family at Envato Elements or you can get the two free weights, Extra Bold & Regular here. 2. Proxima Nova Proxima Nova strikes a balance between typefaces such as Futura and Akzidenz Grotesk, incorporating humanistic proportions and a slightly geometric appearance. This unique combination results in a hybrid font that possesses a contemporary feel. Similarly, Montserrat font shares similarities with Proxima Nova, offering a harmonious blend of modernity and legibility. By drawing inspiration from both Futura and Akzidenz Grotesk, Proxima Nova and Montserrat demonstrate their own distinct characteristics, ensuring an original design. 3. Exensa We simply can’t get enough of Exensa Grotesk, an exquisite Sans Serif typeface that draws inspiration from Swiss Design and the world’s most elegant typefaces. It effortlessly maintains the expressive nature of a premium font, ensuring a top-notch typographic experience. Exensa Grotesk excels in crafting visually appealing headlines that demand attention, while also delivering exceptional legibility for page content. 4. Focus Grotesk We can’t help but share Focus Grotesk. Designed with utmost care and attention to detail, Focus Grotesk is an authentic geometric Sans-Serif typeface that excels in both form and function. Its versatility makes it an excellent choice for a wide range of applications, from body text to headlines, allowing you to create stunning designs for print, web, logo design, marketing graphics, and branding purposes. 5. Albori On our second list, we are delighted to feature Albori, a fresh and contemporary OpenType font family designed with versatility in mind. Albori stands out with its pleasant and highly modern appearance, showcasing a unique personality that is predominantly achieved through its smooth curves and rounded corners. These design elements come together harmoniously throughout the entire font family, creating a cohesive and distinct style. With Albori, you can add a touch of individuality to your projects, making it an excellent choice for various applications such as branding, packaging, and editorial designs. As a font similar to Montserrat, Albori offers a clean and contemporary aesthetic that can elevate your designs to new heights. 6. Pulse We are excited to introduce Pulse, a minimal and timeless sans-serif typeface that we have had the pleasure of using. This font carries a subtle touch of personality, making it a versatile choice for both headers and body text copy. With Pulse, you can achieve a clean and sophisticated look while maintaining readability. The font family encompasses all Latin characters, including accents, as well as letters, numbers, special characters, and punctuation, ensuring comprehensive language support for your projects. 7. Chronograph Introducing our next font, Chronograph! With its clean and vintage aesthetic, Chronograph is a typeface that adds a touch of nostalgia to your designs. It shines particularly well in headlines, logos, posters signs, and many more creative applications. Similar to Montserrat, Chronograph offers a versatile and stylish option for your typographic needs. The font package includes four distinct styles, each contributing to the versatility and adaptability of this typeface. Whether you’re aiming for a classic and timeless look or a retro-inspired design, Chronograph has you covered. 8. Kaiven Introducing Kaiven, a font name that bears a striking resemblance to the popular Montserrat typeface. Like Montserrat, Kaiven embodies a very simple, clean, and minimalist design, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, both personal and commercial. This highly versatile font ensures ease of readability, allowing your content to effortlessly communicate with clarity and elegance. Whether you’re designing a website, creating branding materials, or working on print projects, Kaiven’s clean lines and minimalist aesthetic will provide a contemporary and polished look. 9. Blackden Without Police Allow us to introduce Blackden, a remarkable bold sans-serif font available in a wide range of styles including Bold Oblique, Bold, Extra Light Oblique, Extra Light, Light Oblique, Light, Regular Oblique, Regular, Semi Bold Oblique, Semi Bold, Thin Oblique, and Thin. This extensive variety ensures flexibility and creative freedom in your design projects. Noirden Sans Font is specifically crafted to excel in various applications such as branding, logos, magazines, films, websites, headlines, titles, captions, games, apps, posters, t-shirts, and more. 10. Groningen Introducing Groningen Sans, a modern Sans Serif typeface inspired by the renowned German Grotesk fonts, while maintaining a heightened level of minimalism. With its contemporary design and meticulous attention to detail, Groningen Sans adds a touch of elegance to any project. This font excels in creating impeccable headlines, particularly well-suited for fashion web stores and minimalistic portfolio websites. Whether you’re aiming for a sleek and stylish look or seeking to make a bold statement, Groningen Sans will elevate your typography with its refined aesthetic. 11. Celesta Next on our list is Celesta, a versatile sans-serif font suitable for a wide range of applications. Whether you need to set small text at 5pt or create eye-catching titles, Celesta has got you covered. This font’s flexibility allows it to excel in both delicate and bold typographic settings. Its clean and modern design ensures excellent legibility, even at smaller sizes, while still making a strong impact in larger display settings. 12. Devina Rodent Introducing Devina Rodent font, a modern and elegant typeface that exudes beauty and class. With its 9 different weights, this font offers versatility and flexibility for a wide range of projects. From signatures and stationery to logos, weddings, typography quotes, magazine or book covers, website headers, clothing, branding, and packaging design, Devina Rodent is perfectly suited for various creative endeavors. 13. Stickler We are delighted to incorporate The Stickler into our font collection. This modern and minimal Sans Serif typeface truly embodies the essence of minimalism at its finest. With its clean lines and sleek design, Stickler Sans exudes a timeless elegance that is perfect for both creative and classic typography designs. Whether you’re aiming for a contemporary and innovative look or a more refined and traditional style, Stickler Sans is the ideal choice. 14. Bergen Sands Presenting Bergen Sands, a remarkable contemporary sans-serif font family consisting of 6 fonts. With its clean lines and stylized top inspired by Scandinavian geometry, this typeface embraces the explosive aesthetics of post-Bauhaus design, making it an essential companion in any designer’s creative arsenal. Similar to the popular Montserrat font, Bergen Sans carries a clean and modern look that is perfect for a wide range of design projects. 15. Einer Grotesk Einer Grotesk is an exceptional typeface that excels in a variety of design applications. Whether it’s graphic design, text presentation, web design, print, or display use, this font is a perfect choice. With its versatility and aesthetic appeal, Einer Grotesk shines in beautiful branding projects, logo and logotype designs, captivating marketing graphics, eye-catching banners, impactful posters, striking signage, and cohesive corporate identities. Additionally, when used with added letter-spacing for the Caps, this font becomes ideal for creating minimal headlines and logotypes in web fonts, as showcased in the promotional images. 16. Bremenoff Introducing Bremenoff, a timeless sans-serif typeface family consisting of 14 fonts. With its simplicity woven into every aspect of its design, this typeface exudes a timeless appeal that is sure to captivate. Similar to the beloved Montserrat font, Bremenoff offers a perfect balance between simplicity and elegance, making it an excellent choice for a wide range of design projects. 17. Visia Pro We appreciate your continued scrolling, and now we present to you Visia Pro – a flagship Geometric Sans-Serif typeface. It epitomizes a flawless fusion of elegant, minimal, and premium design aesthetics. VisiaPro is the perfect choice for logotypes, headlines, branding, marketing graphics, posters, corporate identities, and all your web and print needs. With its impeccable design, VisiaPro elevates your projects to a new level of sophistication and visual appeal. Embrace the versatility and refined beauty of VisiaPro as you create stunning designs that leave a lasting impression. 18. Meticula Allow us to introduce Meticula, a sensational sans-serif font family comprising 18 meticulously crafted fonts. With a strong influence from modern sans-serif typefaces and an emphasis on geometric shapes, Meticula embodies the perfect blend of contemporary design and precision. Its minimalistic aesthetic and diverse range of font styles make it an ideal choice for a wide array of typography and graphic design projects. 19. Armitage Last but certainly not least, we are delighted to introduce Armitage—a free sophisticated and contemporary sans serif font family created and generously shared by Dunwich Type Founders. The Armitage font family encompasses 12 unique styles, each exuding a harmonious and robust appearance infused with a timeless American charm. Our Favorite Fonts Similar to Montserrat Still undecided? Below we’ve hand-selected our favorite fonts similar to Montserrat from the list. Exensa Celesta Chronograph Kaiven Noirden Visia Pro Bremenoff Meticula Stickler Pulse Einer Grotesk Groningen Montserrat Font History Montserrat is a widely popular typeface that has gained recognition and widespread use in the design community. Its history is intertwined with a unique story that adds to its allure. The typeface was created by Argentine designer Julieta Ulanovsky as a tribute to the signs and lettering found in the streets of Buenos Aires in the early 20th century. The development of Montserrat began in 2010 when Ulanovsky embarked on a mission to preserve the disappearing typography of her city. She started by photographing and documenting the diverse letterforms she encountered on the streets, capturing the essence of Buenos Aires’ rich typographic heritage. Inspired by the elegance and character of these letterforms, Ulanovsky meticulously digitized and expanded the collection into a complete typeface family. She carefully refined the design, paying attention to details while ensuring the versatility and readability of the font in various applications. Fonts Similar To Helvetica Fonts Similar To Century Gothic Fonts Similar To Comic Sans Fonts Similar To Times New Roman  Fonts Similar to Montserrat Summary We have explored a collection of web fonts that share similarities with the beloved Montserrat font. These fonts offer a diverse range of styles, characteristics, and applications, providing a plethora of options for designers and creatives alike. From the timeless elegance of Focus Grotesk to the contemporary versatility of Albori, each font brings its unique flair to the table. Fonts like Kaiven, Pulse, and Chronograph offer their own interpretations of the clean and minimalist design aesthetic, making them perfect choices for various design projects. Additionally, fonts like Celesta, Exensa Grotesk, and Groningen Sans showcase their individual strengths, catering to different design needs while maintaining the essence of Montserrat’s appeal. Whether you’re seeking fonts for branding, editorial design, web, or print, these alternatives to Montserrat open up a world of possibilities. With their exceptional qualities, readability, and aesthetic appeal, these fonts allow designers to create stunning and impactful designs that stand out. Incorporating fonts similar to Montserrat into your design toolbox adds depth and variety to your typographic palette. The flexibility and versatility offered by these fonts ensure that you have the perfect typeface for any project, elevating your designs and making a lasting impression. Frequently Asked Questions Why is Montserrat font so popular? Montserrat’s well-proportioned letters enhance readability at any size, and its global popularity largely comes from being completely free to use. What are some popular use cases for Montserrat alternatives? Fonts similar to Montserrat, like JUST Sans and Chronograph, work well for branding, websites, logos, headlines, and marketing materials due to their readability and modern appearance. What fonts like Montserrat are best for headlines? Fonts such as Chronograph, Exensa, and Kaiven excel for headlines due to their bold weights, clean lines, and high readability at large sizes.

When it comes to typography, choosing the right font can greatly impact the overall look and feel of a design. Montserrat, with its clean lines and geometric shapes, has become a popular choice among designers for its modern aesthetic.

However, if you’re looking to explore new options and expand your font library, there are several alternatives to Montserrat that offer similar characteristics while adding a unique touch to your projects.

Each font on our list has its own distinctive features, such as varying weights, letterforms, and proportions. We will explore their similarities to Montserrat, highlighting their strengths and potential applications.

Whether you’re seeking a font with a similar vibe or a fresh take on the geometric sans-serif style, this compilation of fonts will help you discover exciting alternatives to Montserrat that suit your design needs.

So, let’s dive into this collection of 15+ fonts similar to Montserrat and unlock a world of typography possibilities to inspire your next project.

BEST FONTS SIMILAR TO MONTSERRAT – UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the Fonts Similar to Montserrat you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

18 Montserrat Alternatives

1. JUST Sans® Clean Modern Minimal Geometric Typeface

JUST Sans is a highly versatile typeface with endearing, modernist warmth, geometric legibility, and a distinctive friendly bite.

Designed as a professional modern geometric sans serif, JUST Sans is both serious and friendly, neutral but warmly expressive, technical but not overt, and familiar but unique enough to stand on its own.

With open-airy characters and a generous width, JUST Sans has an elegant contemporary feel, with sharp angled terminals that give it grip and make it so expressively endearing.

For lovers of modern sans serif fonts who are looking for something a tad more warm, open & expressive, JUST Sans is for you.

You can download the full JUST Sans family at Envato Elements or you can get the two free weights, Extra Bold & Regular here.

2. Proxima Nova

Proxima Nova strikes a balance between typefaces such as Futura and Akzidenz Grotesk, incorporating humanistic proportions and a slightly geometric appearance.

This unique combination results in a hybrid font that possesses a contemporary feel. Similarly, Montserrat font shares similarities with Proxima Nova, offering a harmonious blend of modernity and legibility.

By drawing inspiration from both Futura and Akzidenz Grotesk, Proxima Nova and Montserrat demonstrate their own distinct characteristics, ensuring an original design.

3. Exensa

We simply can’t get enough of Exensa Grotesk, an exquisite Sans Serif typeface that draws inspiration from Swiss Design and the world’s most elegant typefaces.

It effortlessly maintains the expressive nature of a premium font, ensuring a top-notch typographic experience.

Exensa Grotesk excels in crafting visually appealing headlines that demand attention, while also delivering exceptional legibility for page content.

4. Focus Grotesk

We can’t help but share Focus Grotesk. Designed with utmost care and attention to detail, Focus Grotesk is an authentic geometric Sans-Serif typeface that excels in both form and function.

Its versatility makes it an excellent choice for a wide range of applications, from body text to headlines, allowing you to create stunning designs for print, web, logo design, marketing graphics, and branding purposes.

5. Albori

On our second list, we are delighted to feature Albori, a fresh and contemporary OpenType font family designed with versatility in mind.

Albori stands out with its pleasant and highly modern appearance, showcasing a unique personality that is predominantly achieved through its smooth curves and rounded corners. These design elements come together harmoniously throughout the entire font family, creating a cohesive and distinct style.

With Albori, you can add a touch of individuality to your projects, making it an excellent choice for various applications such as branding, packaging, and editorial designs. As a font similar to Montserrat, Albori offers a clean and contemporary aesthetic that can elevate your designs to new heights.

6. Pulse

We are excited to introduce Pulse, a minimal and timeless sans-serif typeface that we have had the pleasure of using.

This font carries a subtle touch of personality, making it a versatile choice for both headers and body text copy. With Pulse, you can achieve a clean and sophisticated look while maintaining readability.

The font family encompasses all Latin characters, including accents, as well as letters, numbers, special characters, and punctuation, ensuring comprehensive language support for your projects.

7. Chronograph

Introducing our next font, Chronograph! With its clean and vintage aesthetic, Chronograph is a typeface that adds a touch of nostalgia to your designs. It shines particularly well in headlines, logos, posters signs, and many more creative applications.

Similar to Montserrat, Chronograph offers a versatile and stylish option for your typographic needs.

The font package includes four distinct styles, each contributing to the versatility and adaptability of this typeface. Whether you’re aiming for a classic and timeless look or a retro-inspired design, Chronograph has you covered.

8. Kaiven

Introducing Kaiven, a font name that bears a striking resemblance to the popular Montserrat typeface.

Like Montserrat, Kaiven embodies a very simple, clean, and minimalist design, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, both personal and commercial. This highly versatile font ensures ease of readability, allowing your content to effortlessly communicate with clarity and elegance.

Whether you’re designing a website, creating branding materials, or working on print projects, Kaiven’s clean lines and minimalist aesthetic will provide a contemporary and polished look.

9. Blackden Without Police

Allow us to introduce Blackden, a remarkable bold sans-serif font available in a wide range of styles including Bold Oblique, Bold, Extra Light Oblique, Extra Light, Light Oblique, Light, Regular Oblique, Regular, Semi Bold Oblique, Semi Bold, Thin Oblique, and Thin.

This extensive variety ensures flexibility and creative freedom in your design projects. Noirden Sans Font is specifically crafted to excel in various applications such as branding, logos, magazines, films, websites, headlines, titles, captions, games, apps, posters, t-shirts, and more.

10. Groningen

Introducing Groningen Sans, a modern Sans Serif typeface inspired by the renowned German Grotesk fonts, while maintaining a heightened level of minimalism. With its contemporary design and meticulous attention to detail, Groningen Sans adds a touch of elegance to any project.

This font excels in creating impeccable headlines, particularly well-suited for fashion web stores and minimalistic portfolio websites. Whether you’re aiming for a sleek and stylish look or seeking to make a bold statement, Groningen Sans will elevate your typography with its refined aesthetic.

11. Celesta

Next on our list is Celesta, a versatile sans-serif font suitable for a wide range of applications.

Whether you need to set small text at 5pt or create eye-catching titles, Celesta has got you covered.

This font’s flexibility allows it to excel in both delicate and bold typographic settings. Its clean and modern design ensures excellent legibility, even at smaller sizes, while still making a strong impact in larger display settings.

12. Devina Rodent

Introducing Devina Rodent font, a modern and elegant typeface that exudes beauty and class.

With its 9 different weights, this font offers versatility and flexibility for a wide range of projects.

From signatures and stationery to logos, weddings, typography quotes, magazine or book covers, website headers, clothing, branding, and packaging design, Devina Rodent is perfectly suited for various creative endeavors.

13. Stickler

We are delighted to incorporate The Stickler into our font collection. This modern and minimal Sans Serif typeface truly embodies the essence of minimalism at its finest.

With its clean lines and sleek design, Stickler Sans exudes a timeless elegance that is perfect for both creative and classic typography designs.

Whether you’re aiming for a contemporary and innovative look or a more refined and traditional style, Stickler Sans is the ideal choice.

14. Bergen Sands

Presenting Bergen Sands, a remarkable contemporary sans-serif font family consisting of 6 fonts.

With its clean lines and stylized top inspired by Scandinavian geometry, this typeface embraces the explosive aesthetics of post-Bauhaus design, making it an essential companion in any designer’s creative arsenal.

Similar to the popular Montserrat font, Bergen Sans carries a clean and modern look that is perfect for a wide range of design projects.

15. Einer Grotesk

Einer Grotesk is an exceptional typeface that excels in a variety of design applications.

Whether it’s graphic design, text presentation, web design, print, or display use, this font is a perfect choice.

With its versatility and aesthetic appeal, Einer Grotesk shines in beautiful branding projects, logo and logotype designs, captivating marketing graphics, eye-catching banners, impactful posters, striking signage, and cohesive corporate identities.

Additionally, when used with added letter-spacing for the Caps, this font becomes ideal for creating minimal headlines and logotypes in web fonts, as showcased in the promotional images.

16. Bremenoff

Introducing Bremenoff, a timeless sans-serif typeface family consisting of 14 fonts. With its simplicity woven into every aspect of its design, this typeface exudes a timeless appeal that is sure to captivate.

Similar to the beloved Montserrat font, Bremenoff offers a perfect balance between simplicity and elegance, making it an excellent choice for a wide range of design projects.

17. Visia Pro

We appreciate your continued scrolling, and now we present to you Visia Pro – a flagship Geometric Sans-Serif typeface.

It epitomizes a flawless fusion of elegant, minimal, and premium design aesthetics.

VisiaPro is the perfect choice for logotypes, headlines, branding, marketing graphics, posters, corporate identities, and all your web and print needs.

With its impeccable design, VisiaPro elevates your projects to a new level of sophistication and visual appeal. Embrace the versatility and refined beauty of VisiaPro as you create stunning designs that leave a lasting impression.

18. Meticula

Allow us to introduce Meticula, a sensational sans-serif font family comprising 18 meticulously crafted fonts.

With a strong influence from modern sans-serif typefaces and an emphasis on geometric shapes, Meticula embodies the perfect blend of contemporary design and precision.

Its minimalistic aesthetic and diverse range of font styles make it an ideal choice for a wide array of typography and graphic design projects.

19. Armitage

Last but certainly not least, we are delighted to introduce Armitage—a free sophisticated and contemporary sans serif font family created and generously shared by Dunwich Type Founders.

The Armitage font family encompasses 12 unique styles, each exuding a harmonious and robust appearance infused with a timeless American charm.

Our Favorite Fonts Similar to Montserrat

Still undecided? Below we’ve hand-selected our favorite fonts similar to Montserrat from the list.

Montserrat Font History

Montserrat is a widely popular typeface that has gained recognition and widespread use in the design community. Its history is intertwined with a unique story that adds to its allure.

The typeface was created by Argentine designer Julieta Ulanovsky as a tribute to the signs and lettering found in the streets of Buenos Aires in the early 20th century.

The development of Montserrat began in 2010 when Ulanovsky embarked on a mission to preserve the disappearing typography of her city. She started by photographing and documenting the diverse letterforms she encountered on the streets, capturing the essence of Buenos Aires’ rich typographic heritage.

Inspired by the elegance and character of these letterforms, Ulanovsky meticulously digitized and expanded the collection into a complete typeface family. She carefully refined the design, paying attention to details while ensuring the versatility and readability of the font in various applications.

  • Fonts Similar To Helvetica
  • Fonts Similar To Century Gothic
  • Fonts Similar To Comic Sans
  • Fonts Similar To Times New Roman 

Fonts Similar to Montserrat Summary

We have explored a collection of web fonts that share similarities with the beloved Montserrat font. These fonts offer a diverse range of styles, characteristics, and applications, providing a plethora of options for designers and creatives alike.

From the timeless elegance of Focus Grotesk to the contemporary versatility of Albori, each font brings its unique flair to the table. Fonts like Kaiven, Pulse, and Chronograph offer their own interpretations of the clean and minimalist design aesthetic, making them perfect choices for various design projects.

Additionally, fonts like Celesta, Exensa Grotesk, and Groningen Sans showcase their individual strengths, catering to different design needs while maintaining the essence of Montserrat’s appeal.

Whether you’re seeking fonts for branding, editorial design, web, or print, these alternatives to Montserrat open up a world of possibilities. With their exceptional qualities, readability, and aesthetic appeal, these fonts allow designers to create stunning and impactful designs that stand out.

Incorporating fonts similar to Montserrat into your design toolbox adds depth and variety to your typographic palette. The flexibility and versatility offered by these fonts ensure that you have the perfect typeface for any project, elevating your designs and making a lasting impression.

Frequently Asked Questions

Why is Montserrat font so popular?

Montserrat’s well-proportioned letters enhance readability at any size, and its global popularity largely comes from being completely free to use.

What are some popular use cases for Montserrat alternatives?

Fonts similar to Montserrat, like JUST Sans and Chronograph, work well for branding, websites, logos, headlines, and marketing materials due to their readability and modern appearance.

What fonts like Montserrat are best for headlines?

Fonts such as Chronograph, Exensa, and Kaiven excel for headlines due to their bold weights, clean lines, and high readability at large sizes.
